thread.title: White Station cruises; Brighton hands Munford first loss
thread.title_full: White Station cruises; Brighton hands Munford first loss

author: John Varlas
title: White Station cruises; Brighton hands Munford first loss
text:
Related Coverage Brighton spoils Munford’s perfect record White Station routs Germantown Week 10 prep football roundup How the Dandy Dozen fared in Week 10 Prep football scores and summaries from Oct. 23 Plenty of good defense — and plenty of Dillon Mitchell — gave White Station, ranked sixth in The Commercial Appeal Dandy Dozen , a big Region 4-6A victory Friday at the Fairgrounds.
The Spartans (6-3, 5-1) held the Red Devils to 98 total yards in a 38-0 win . Much of the offense came from Mitchell, who caught scoring passes of 27, 29 and 51 yards from Burk Williams. Germantown falls to 4-5 and 3-3.
Malik Matthews scored on a 1-yard run with less than two minutes to go, then Cameron John sacked Munford quarterback Jacob Ross on fourth down as No. 12 Brighton (8-1, 5-1 Region 8-5A) knocked off the fourth-ranked Cougars (8-1, 5-1), 24-20. Malik Jackson had two TD passes for Brighton, which won just three games last year.
Top-ranked Whitehaven improved to 8-1 with a 29-6 victory over Collierville. Darrion Cole had two touchdown runs, Kylan Watkins had 172 yards and a score and Ray Booker had a 71-yard touchdown run. The Tigers host No. 7 Cordova in the regular-season finale next Friday. The Wolves got 293 yards passing and three touchdowns from Devin Coleman to defeat Houston, 41-20.
Third-ranked MUS and No. 5 CBHS warmed up for next week's showdown with easy wins. Bradley Foley scored four first-half touchdowns as the Owls (7-2) beat Craigmont, 42-22 while the Brothers (7-2) held Catholic to minus-32 total yards in a 67-0 victory.
Eighth-ranked Northpoint got 120 yards and touchdown from Christian Saulsberry and two scoring runs from Nelson Fabrizius to finish the regular-season 10-0 with a 42-14 over Fayette-Ware. No. 9 St. George's will take on USJ for the region title next week after a 49-14 win over MAHS. Chase Hayden ran for 225 yards and accounted for four touchdowns to lead the Gryphons (8-1).
Visit the Prep Sports page for more stories, roundups, scores and summaries.
